segments.text: This entire scene is making me feel quite overwhelmed.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sheer obliviousness of the woman is truly infuriating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she not hear the gushing water or feel the puddle expanding?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's going to ruin everything, that beautiful kitchen will be a mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And those poor children, they're going to get hurt if that stool tips.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can already imagine the splash, the cries, the broken dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's such a preventable disaster, just waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: My stomach churns watching the water flow so freely onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could reach in and just turn off that faucet right now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This domestic tranquility is such a facade; chaos is brewing beneath the surface.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It truly highlights how quickly things can go wrong when attention wanders.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to shout, "Look around you!" to the woman.
segments.speaker: PAR
